intro: Choripetalum viridiflorum, commonly known as the green-flowered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, silvery down, while its stems are upright and often branched. The flowers bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
